intro: Reynosia laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, smooth leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils or in open woodlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Reynosia laevigata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in drought conditions.
